If you are a student under 26, you are entitled to a reduced student-rate pass for two zones (100 and 101) which is the most practical. To get your Public transport ticket you have two options: 

•	Physical transport pass 

•	Electronic transport pass

We recommend getting the Electronic pass, all you need is a contactless bank card (it will be your ticket carrier) and a card with authorised online international payments to pay for the ticket. After your arrival in Brno, you only have to go to one of the DPMB shops once to verify your Brno ID account and then you can conveniently buy your monthly/quarterly tickets online. You can find the detailed guide here(link to pdf).

If you decide to get a physical version you need ISIC/STUDENT CARD, ID/Passport, photo(25x25), money. You will take all of these things and go to the Public Transport office (Novobranská 693/18, 602 00 Brno-střed) and get your Tram Ticket (Šalinkartu) there!

For occasional travel around Brno, you can buy a single-use ticket. Its validity is time and zone limited (zones 100 and 101 will suffice). Tickets are sold through yellow vending machines at some stops, DPMB shops, kiosks and railway stations. You can also buy a ticket for a higher price in the bus or tram, just ask the driver and be sure to have the exact amount of money. The ticket is valid from the moment it has been validated for the period specified on it and only in those tariff zones marked on the ticket. Aside from special tickets valid outside of zones 100 and 101, you can change vehicles with all kinds of tickets within the time limit. The ticket does not have to be validated again during transfers.

You can also buy an SMS ticket by sending a text to number 90206, but it is only possible with a Czech SIM card (make sure the “Premium SMS” service is activated with your mobile provider). You have to wait for the confirmation SMS (approximately 2 minutes) before you board the vehicle.

•	“BRNO20” 20 minutes ticket for 20 CZK

•	“BRNO” 75 minutes ticket for 29 CZK

•	“BRNOD” 24 hours ticket for 99 CZK

Another option is to use DPMB app and buy it through it.

#Appdevelopment  Student survival Guide

Theme 1  Paying the waste fee.

 All foreign nationals living temporarily in Brno, longer than 3 months, is obligated to pay a local waste fee. The basic fee is around 670 czk for a calendar year, though the sum might change per year. You don't have to pay the full amount, only for the period of time you live in Brno.

 It can be paid in 2 ways

  Digitally (recommended)

  In person

 #How to pay digitally: BrnoID  [https://www.brnoid.cz/en/payforwaste](https://www.brnoid.cz/en/payforwaste) The easiest way is to pay through BrnoID.cz. It is a digital platform that helps citizens of Brno use city services online. It's great, use it.

 [This link](https://www.brnoid.cz/en/payforwaste) will take you directly to the payment form. You have to register a basic BrnoID account, which only requires an email and a password.

 !  Filling in your arrival date and estimated departure in the form will calculate how much you have to pay.

 The form should be selfexplanatory, but you have to figure out your address and post code.

 This website can help you out:

 [https://worldpostalcode.com/czechrepublic/brnomesto](https://worldpostalcode.com/czechrepublic/brnomesto) There is a search by map function at the bottom 

 #How to pay in Person: Šumavská 35C, 3th floor

 If for some reason you can't do your payments online, it can be done in person. Go to this address:Šumavská 35C, 3th floor.

 Directions: The closest tram/busstops are **Klusáčkova** and **Tábor**. It is a 4minute walk from each stop. 350400meters.

 To **Klusáčkova** by:

  Tram: #12 (easiest)

  Buss: #34, #36 #68,

 To **Tábor** by:

  Tram: #3, #11

  Buss:  #68

 When making a payment in cash at the cash desk you need to know the name and surname, address and date of birth for each of the fee payers that you are making payment for.

 **Cash desk opening hours:**

 Mon. and Weds.: 8:00  17:00

 Tues.:                   8:00  12:00 and 13:00  14:30

 Thurs.:                 8:00  12:00 and 13:00  14:00

 Fri.:                       8:00  12:00
